result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark J Burmesch was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant to pay all court costs, supervision fees and any costs of treatment as a condition of probation.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.
Defendant is granted privileges set forth in Wis Stats 303.08
Court orders absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants.  No use or possession of controlled substances unless valid prescription and in original containers.
Defendant to submit to random testing.
Defendant to participate in drug and/or alcohol counseling and treatment deemed appropriate by DOC and to pay all costs of treatment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mark J Burmesch

defendant.name: Burmesch, Mark J
defendant.address: 436 E Norport Dr, Port Washington, WI 53074

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: report on 2/5/15 at 5:00 to Ozaukee County Jail.

Defendant Mark J Burmesch in court with attorney Robert Douglas Stansbury.  Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advised the defendant pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes Section 973.176, that as a convicted felon she/he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also she/he may not vote in any election until their civil rights have been restored.
Letter from Attorney Stansbury with attached character letters regarding defendant, letter report from The Gilane Center and AA Meeting Verification Form.
Atty Stansbury requesting B2 hear cases 14TR4104, 4105, 4106 currently assigned to B3 - scanned and forwarded to B2.
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 3, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Mark J Burmesch in court with attorney Robert Douglas Stansbury.  Jeffrey A. Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense requests adjournment for projected disposition.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 3, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
Further proceedings on December 8, 2014 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Mark J Burmesch in court with attorney Robert Douglas Stansbury.  Jeffrey A. Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing waived.  Court finds probable cause and orders matter bound over for arraignment. Information filed.   Information read, defendant advised of penalties, further reading waived. Plea of not guilty entered.  Further proceedings scheduled for December 8, 2014 at 01:15 pm.

Conditions set by court: SCRAM same date as release from jail,  Court orders absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.

Defendant Mark J Burmesch in court with attorney Robert Douglas Stansbury.  Defendant in custody. Adam Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant appears by video conferencing from Ozaukee County Jail.  Waive reading of felony complaint.  Time limits waived for preliminary hearing on felony complaint.  Court orders adjournment, allowing time for defendant to decide whether preliminary hearing will be requested.  Status conference scheduled for November 6, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
